A: The mask shades the projection screen and prevents the finderscope from receiving direct sunlight, while the cloth blocks light leakage between the tube and mask to sharpen the image.
The circular card mask helps to block out any direct sunlight that may fall on the projection screen, which could cause distortion or other issues with the image being projected. Additionally, the small cloth placed over the finderscope helps to prevent light from leaking through and affecting the clarity of the image being viewed through the telescope. Together, these two elements help to ensure that the image being projected is clear, sharp, and free from any unwanted distractions.
